question: People doing dangerous sports activities like scuba diving and bungi jumping, they should be responsible for their own life and rescue workers should not risk their lives to save people. Do you agree or disagree?
text: It is no doubt that sport is supported to enhance our health, however, several certain sports like scuba diving and bungi jumping are indeed risky to participate as well as relevant  works to save people. I completely agree that citizens should have the responsibility about their life and aid officer should guarantee the safety of gamers.

Those sports have several dangers, predominately accident rates. Serious injuries such as bone fractures and head trauma are not uncommon in the extreme sports, even fatal accidents. It is too much money to participate in those activities merely for excitements. Most insurance schemes like society insurance do not cover those vigorous sports because of the high medical expenditures on the injuries. As a result, people should understand that those extreme activities are actually dangerous and pay a lot. Consequently, gamers do take care of their own lives rather than playing a venture game.

On the other hand, the living survival plays a key role in each person, which rescue officers should have many professional skills to assist emergency cases. Actually, the more experience you have, the fewer mistakes you will rescue. It is compelling that people participating in the dangerous sports are responsible for warranty equipment preparation, especially, aid workers.

In conclusion, citizens should understand the risky disadvantage in playing the venture sports such as the activities of swimming or jumping. More importantly, both participants and rescue officers exactly know the best method to protect themselves and others. In my opinion, people should not do those kinds of sports unless there has any practical experience.
